items.title: What Is Oleo Saccharum, and How Do You Use It in Cocktails?
items.excerpt: It’s a simple ingredient with a fancy name: oleo saccharum. Meaning “sugar oil” in Latin, oleo saccharum is the result of placing citrus peels in sugar to pull out their essential oils. The technique produces a flavored sugar or syrup to use in cocktails.
